Description: The Imperium of Man is humanity's galaxy-spanning empire, ruled in the Emperor's name. It encompasses billions of worlds and multiple military and religious organizations.
Question: What is the main human faction in Warhammer 40k?

Description: Space Marines (Adeptus Astartes) are surgically enhanced super-soldiers created from human stock using gene-seed. They're humanity's greatest warriors, organized into Chapters of ~1,000 marines.
Question: What are the genetically enhanced super soldiers of the Imperium called?

Description: The Astra Militarum (Imperial Guard) is the Imperium's conventional military. Unlike Space Marines, Guardsmen are regular humans. They win through numbers, tanks, and artillery.
Question: What is the standard human military force of the Imperium?

Description: The Adeptus Mechanicus worships the Machine God (Omnissiah), believing technology is sacred. Based on Mars, they maintain the Imperium's technology and manufacture weapons.
Question: What faction worships machines and technology?

Description: Necrons were once the Necrontyr, an organic race who transferred their consciousness into metal bodies millions of years ago. They sleep in tomb worlds, slowly awakening.
Question: What are the ancient robotic warriors who sleep in tomb worlds?

Description: The Aeldari (Eldar) are an ancient race whose empire fell when their excess birthed Slaanesh. Craftworld Eldar travel on massive spacecraft, following the Path system to avoid corruption.
Question: What alien race travels on massive craftworlds?

Description: The T'au Empire is a young, technologically advanced civilization promoting 'The Greater Good' ideology. They use battlesuits and advanced weaponry, incorporating allied species called auxiliaries.
Question: What faction uses battlesuits and believes in 'The Greater Good'?

Description: Orks are a green-skinned fungal species living for combat. Their collective psychic field (WAAAGH!) can make things work just because they believe they should.
Question: What green-skinned race lives for fighting and believes things work if they believe hard enough?

Description: Tyranids are an extra-galactic swarm that consumes all biomass. They travel in Hive Fleets, adapting to overcome any defense. Genestealers infiltrate worlds before invasions.
Question: What is the all-consuming alien swarm from beyond the galaxy?

Description: Chaos Space Marines are Astartes who turned traitor during the Horus Heresy. They serve the Chaos Gods and have fought the Imperium for 10,000 years from the Eye of Terror.
Question: What are Space Marines who have turned to Chaos called?

Description: The Emperor created 20 Primarchs and 20 Legions. Two Legions (II and XI) were expunged from records, and 9 turned traitor, leaving 9 loyalist Legions that became Chapters.
Question: How many original Space Marine Legions were there?
RegExDescription: Accepts 20 in numeric or word form

Description: Nine Legions turned traitor: Sons of Horus, Emperor's Children, Iron Warriors, Night Lords, World Eaters, Death Guard, Thousand Sons, Word Bearers, and Alpha Legion.
Question: How many Legions turned traitor during the Horus Heresy?
RegExDescription: Accepts 9 in numeric or word form

Description: The Adepta Sororitas (Sisters of Battle) are female warriors of the Ecclesiarchy. Since the Ecclesiarchy can't maintain 'men under arms,' they use these faithful warriors instead.
Question: What are the elite female warriors of the Ecclesiarchy?

Description: The Emperor of Mankind is a millennia-old immortal psyker who united Terra and led the Great Crusade. After Horus wounded him, he's sustained by the Golden Throne.
Question: Who is the immortal ruler of the Imperium sitting on the Golden Throne?

Description: Horus Lupercal was the Warmaster and Primarch of the Luna Wolves (later Sons of Horus). Corrupted by Chaos, he led half the Legions against the Emperor in the Horus Heresy.
Question: Who was the Warmaster that led the rebellion against the Emperor?

Description: Roboute Guilliman, Primarch of the Ultramarines, was resurrected in M41 using Eldar technology. He now serves as Lord Commander, reforming the Imperium and leading its defense.
Question: Who is the current leader of the Ultramarines and Lord Commander of the Imperium?

Description: Primarchs are the 20 superhuman sons of the Emperor, created from his genetic material with Warp enhancement. Each led a Space Marine Legion during the Great Crusade.
Question: Who are the superhuman sons of the Emperor who led the Space Marine Legions?

Description: Abaddon the Despoiler was Horus's First Captain and now leads the Black Legion. He's launched 13 Black Crusades from the Eye of Terror, finally breaking Cadia in the 13th.
Question: Who is the Warmaster of Chaos and leader of the Black Legion?

Description: Lion El'Jonson, Primarch of the Dark Angels, was called 'The Lion.' He recently returned in M42, though his Legion harbors dark secrets about the Fallen.
Question: Who is the Primarch of the Dark Angels?

Description: Leman Russ, Primarch of the Space Wolves, was known as the Emperor's executioner. He disappeared into the Eye of Terror, and his Legion awaits his return.
Question: Who is the Primarch of the Space Wolves?

Description: Sanguinius, the Angel, had actual wings and was beloved by all. His death at Horus's hands is a defining tragedy - he could have been Warmaster instead of Horus.
Question: Who is the winged Primarch of the Blood Angels?

Description: Horus killed Sanguinius aboard the Vengeful Spirit during the Siege of Terra. This happened just before Horus's final battle with the Emperor.
Question: Which Primarch killed Sanguinius?

Description: Magnus the Red, Primarch of the Thousand Sons, was a powerful psyker who accidentally broke the Emperor's Webway project. He's now a Daemon Primarch of Tzeentch.
Question: Who is the Daemon Primarch of the Thousand Sons?

Description: Commander Dante has led the Blood Angels for over 1,100 years, making him the oldest non-Dreadnought Space Marine. He's one of the Imperium's greatest heroes.
Question: Who is the oldest living Space Marine, Chapter Master of the Blood Angels?

Description: The four major Chaos Gods are Khorne, Tzeentch, Nurgle, and Slaanesh. Each embodies different aspects of mortal emotion and has daemons, mortal followers, and traitor Legions.
Question: How many major Chaos Gods are there?
RegExDescription: Accepts 4 in numeric or word form

Description: Khorne (Blood God), Tzeentch (Change), Nurgle (Decay), and Slaanesh (Excess) are the main Chaos Gods. Each has sacred numbers, colors, and daemon types.
Question: What are the four Chaos Gods?

Description: Khorne is the Blood God of war, martial honor, and slaughter. He hates psykers and sorcery. His followers seek skulls for his throne and blood for his glory.
Question: Which Chaos God is the Blood God of war and violence?

Description: Tzeentch is the Architect of Fate, god of change, magic, and manipulation. His plans within plans are incomprehensible. He favors psykers and sorcerers.
Question: Which Chaos God is the Lord of Change and master of sorcery?

Description: Nurgle is the Plague Father, god of disease, decay, and despair - but also resilience and acceptance. His followers embrace decay as the natural cycle.
Question: Which Chaos God is the Plague Father of disease and decay?

Description: Slaanesh is the youngest Chaos God, born from the Eldar's excess. They represent pleasure, perfection, and sensation taken to extremes. Slaanesh hungers for Eldar souls.
Question: Which Chaos God is the Prince of Pleasure and excess?

Description: Khorne's famous cry is 'Blood for the Blood God! Skulls for the Skull Throne!' It encapsulates his nature - he cares only for the violence, not who dies.
Question: What is Khorne's famous battle cry?
Answers: Blood for the Blood God! Skulls for the Skull Throne!

Description: Slaanesh was born from the collective psychic excess of the Eldar empire. This cataclysm, the Fall of the Eldar, destroyed their civilization and created the Eye of Terror.
Question: What event birthed Slaanesh?

Description: Daemons are Warp entities, manifestations of emotion and Chaos God power. They can only exist in realspace temporarily without a Warp rift or daemonic possession.
Question: What are entities born of the Warp called?

Description: The Warp (Immaterium) is a parallel dimension of psychic energy. It enables faster-than-light travel but is incredibly dangerous, filled with daemons and Chaos.
Question: What is the dimension of psychic energy that allows faster-than-light travel?

Description: The Golden Throne sustains the Emperor's body and mind, allowing him to power the Astronomican and hold back Warp incursions. It's slowly failing.
Question: What device keeps the Emperor alive on Terra?

Description: The Astronomican is a psychic beacon projected from Terra by the Emperor and a choir of psykers. It allows Navigators to guide ships through the Warp.
Question: What is the psychic beacon that allows Warp travel?

Description: The Horus Heresy (30K-31K) was a galaxy-wide civil war. Half the Space Marine Legions turned traitor, and the Emperor was mortally wounded defeating Horus.
Question: What is the civil war that nearly destroyed the Imperium called?

Description: The 'current' setting is the 41st/42nd Millennium (often written M41/M42). Guilliman's return and the Great Rift opened in the 'Gathering Storm' storyline.
Question: What millennium is the 'current' setting of Warhammer 40k?

Description: The Cicatrix Maledictum (Great Rift) is a galaxy-spanning Warp rift that split the Imperium in half. The dark side (Imperium Nihilus) is cut off from the Astronomican.
Question: What is the great Warp rift that split the galaxy in half?

Description: Terra (Earth) is humanity's homeworld and the Imperium's capital. It's a hive world of continent-spanning cities, containing the Imperial Palace and the Golden Throne.
Question: What is the homeworld of humanity in Warhammer 40k?

Description: Mars is the homeworld of the Adeptus Mechanicus and the Imperium's primary forge world. The Fabricator-General of Mars is among the most powerful Imperial figures.
Question: What planet is the homeworld of the Adeptus Mechanicus?

Description: Cadia was a fortress world guarding the Cadian Gate, the most stable route from the Eye of Terror. Abaddon destroyed it in the 13th Black Crusade, but its people survived.
Question: What was the famous last stand phrase associated with Cadia?
Answers: The planet broke before the Guard did

Description: Games Workshop, a British company, creates Warhammer 40,000. Founded in 1975, they also make Warhammer Age of Sigmar, the Horus Heresy game, and related products.
Question: What company produces Warhammer 40,000?

Description: D6 (six-sided dice) are the primary dice in Warhammer 40K. Most rolls use D6s for hit, wound, and save rolls. Some rules use D3 (roll D6 divided by 2, round up).
Question: What are the main six-sided dice used in 40k commonly called?

Description: Most 40K miniatures are 28mm 'heroic scale' (measured to the eye). Newer Primaris Marines are slightly larger. The scale is stylized rather than realistic.
Question: What scale are most Warhammer 40k miniatures?

Description: Points (or Power Level as an alternative) balance army lists. Each unit costs points based on its capabilities. Standard games are often 2000 points.
Question: What is the points system used to balance army lists called?

Description: Command Points fuel Stratagems, which are special abilities usable during games. You start with CP based on your detachments and can spend them for various effects.
Question: What resource allows using Stratagems during a game?

Description: 10th Edition launched in 2023, simplifying many rules while keeping core 40K gameplay. It features new datasheets, army rules, and streamlined mechanics.
Question: What is the current edition of Warhammer 40k as of 2025?

Description: Warhammer 40,000 was released in 1987 as 'Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader.' It was originally more RPG-like before evolving into the current tabletop wargame.
Question: What year was Warhammer 40,000 first released?
RegExDescription: Accepts 1987 in numeric or word form

Description: Rogue Trader was the first edition's full name. It focused more on small squads and roleplaying elements. The setting has evolved significantly since then.
Question: What was the original name of Warhammer 40,000?

Description: The tagline 'In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only war' perfectly captures 40K's grimdark tone - a decaying empire fighting endless wars.
Question: What phrase represents the grimdark nature of 40k?
Answers: In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only war
IncorrectAnswers: Only the dead have seen the end of war
In war, there are no winners
Suffer not the xenos to live
Have you tried turning it off and on again

Description: Archeotech refers to ancient technology from the Dark Age of Technology (M15-25). Much has been lost, and working archeotech is incredibly valuable and poorly understood.
Question: What is the in-universe term for ancient technology?

Description: The Adeptus Custodes are the Emperor's personal bodyguards, created by him directly. Each is a masterwork, far surpassing even Space Marines in combat ability.
Question: What are the Emperor's personal bodyguards called?

Description: Grey Knights are a secret Chapter of Space Marines who specialize in fighting daemons. All are psykers, immune to corruption, and their existence is kept hidden.
Question: What Space Marine Chapter hunts daemons and is immune to Chaos corruption?

Description: Kh√¢rn the Betrayer is the greatest mortal champion of Khorne. He's killed so many (including his own allies) that he earned his title. He wields Gorechild, Angron's old chainaxe.
Question: Who is Kharn the Betrayer?

Description: Bloodthirsters are Khorne's Greater Daemons - massive winged creatures of rage and violence. They're among the deadliest beings in existence.
Question: What type of Greater Daemon serves Khorne?

Description: Lords of Change are Tzeentch's Greater Daemons - bird-like sorcerers wielding reality-warping magic. They're cunning manipulators who play long games.
Question: What type of Greater Daemon serves Tzeentch?

Description: Great Unclean Ones are Nurgle's Greater Daemons - bloated, jovial beings spreading plague and corruption. They're disgustingly friendly and nearly impossible to kill.
Question: What type of Greater Daemon serves Nurgle?

Description: Keepers of Secrets are Slaanesh's Greater Daemons - elegant, terrifying beings of grace and cruelty. They embody perfection and sensory extremes.
Question: What type of Greater Daemon serves Slaanesh?

Description: The Black Library (in-universe) is hidden in the Webway, containing all knowledge of Chaos. The Harlequins guard it. (Real-world: Games Workshop's publishing arm)
Question: What is the Black Library?
Answers: The Eldar repository of forbidden knowledge in the Webway

Description: C'tan are star gods who tricked the Necrontyr into becoming Necrons. The Necrons later shattered them into shards. The Deceiver, Nightbringer, and Void Dragon are notable C'tan.
Question: What are the mysterious ancient star-gods that created the Necrons?

Description: Commorragh is the Dark Eldar (Drukhari) capital in the Webway. It's a lawless realm of suffering where the Dark Eldar torture souls to stave off Slaanesh's hunger.
Question: What is the name of the Dark Eldar's home city in the Webway?

Description: The Dark Angels are the First Legion, with a shameful secret: some members turned traitor (the Fallen) during the Heresy. They obsessively hunt these traitors.
Question: Which Space Marine Chapter is known as 'The Unforgiven' and hunts the Fallen?

Description: The Beast was an Ork Warlord of unprecedented power who nearly conquered Terra in M32. Defeating him required the combined efforts of multiple Chapters and the Mechanicus.
Question: What is the name of the Ork warlord who led the War of the Beast?

Description: Crisis Battlesuits are T'au combat walkers piloted by elite Fire Warriors. They're highly mobile, heavily armed, and the iconic image of T'au warfare.
Question: What are the elite troops of the Tau Empire who use jetpacks called?

Description: The Szarekhan Dynasty is the Silent King Szarekh's own dynasty. He seeks to unite the Necrons and find a way to restore their flesh-and-blood bodies.
Question: What Necron dynasty is led by the Silent King Szarekh?

Description: Sanguinius was called 'The Angel' due to his magnificent white wings. He was considered the noblest Primarch, and many believe he could have been chosen as Warmaster instead of Horus.
Question: Which Primarch was known as 'The Angel' and had actual wings?

Description: High Marshal Helbrecht leads the Black Templars, the largest Chapter. Unlike most Chapters, the Templars maintain a crusading fleet rather than a home world.
Question: Who is the Chapter Master of the Black Templars?

Description: Marneus Calgar is Chapter Master of the Ultramarines. He was the first to receive Primaris reinforcements and has led the Chapter for centuries.
Question: What is the name of the first Captain of the Ultramarines 1st Company?

Description: The High Lords of Terra are 12 leaders of the Imperium's most powerful organizations. The positions change as organizations gain or lose influence.
Question: Who is the current High Lord of Terra and Master of the Administratum?

Description: Luther was the Dark Angels' second-in-command who turned traitor on Caliban. He was imprisoned for millennia but has recently escaped after becoming a Daemon Prince.
Question: What is the name of the Fallen Dark Angel who became a Daemon Prince?

Description: Be'lakor is the first Daemon Prince, elevated by all four Chaos Gods but now serving none. He's a powerful entity of Chaos Undivided with millennia of scheming.
Question: What is the Warp entity that exists as the 'fifth' Chaos power and represents Chaos Undivided?

Description: Khorne's sacred number is 8. His followers often organize in groups of 8 or 8x8 (such as 8 Bloodthirsters in the Blood Legion of 8 x 8 x 8 daemons).
Question: What are the sacred number of Khorne?
RegExDescription: Accepts 8 in numeric or word form

Description: Tzeentch's sacred number is 9. The Thousand Sons and Tzeentch daemons often incorporate this number in their organizations and rituals.
Question: What are the sacred number of Tzeentch?
RegExDescription: Accepts 9 in numeric or word form

Description: Nurgle's sacred number is 7. The Death Guard, his favored Legion, frequently uses this number in squad sizes and rituals.
Question: What is Nurgle's sacred number?
RegExDescription: Accepts 7 in numeric or word form

Description: Slaanesh's sacred number is 6. The Emperor's Children and Slaanesh's daemons organize around this number in their corrupted perfectionism.
Question: What is Slaanesh's sacred number?
RegExDescription: Accepts 6 in numeric or word form

Description: The Rock is the Dark Angels' mobile fortress-monastery - actually a chunk of their destroyed home world Caliban. It holds their deepest secrets in its depths.
Question: What is the name of the fortress-monastery of the Dark Angels?

Description: Horus mortally wounded the Emperor aboard the Vengeful Spirit in Terra's orbit during the Siege of Terra. The Emperor killed Horus but was placed on the Golden Throne.
Question: What planet did Horus mortally wound the Emperor on?

Description: The Fortress of Hera on Macragge is the Ultramarines' headquarters. It's named after a Greek goddess, fitting the Legion's Greco-Roman aesthetic.
Question: What is the name of the Ultramarines' fortress-monastery?

Description: The Fang is the Space Wolves' fortress on Fenris. It's the largest Space Marine fortress-monastery, built into a mountain in the frozen world.
Question: What is the name of the Space Wolves' fortress on Fenris?

Description: The Baneblade is a super-heavy tank with multiple variants (Shadowsword, Stormlord, etc.). It's the Imperial Guard's premiere armored vehicle for major engagements.
Question: What is the name of the massive superheavy tank used by the Imperial Guard?

Description: The Boltgun (Bolter) fires self-propelled mass-reactive shells that explode inside targets. It's the iconic Space Marine weapon, powerful enough to devastate most enemies.
Question: What is the standard weapon of a Tactical Space Marine?

Description: Rick Priestley was the primary designer of Warhammer 40,000 and wrote the original Rogue Trader rulebook. He's one of the most influential figures in tabletop wargaming.
Question: Who wrote the original Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader rulebook?

Description: Ynnead is the Aeldari god of the dead, partially awakened by Yvraine. The Ynnari faction believes Ynnead can defeat Slaanesh and free the Eldar from their doom.
Question: What is the name of the Aeldari god of the dead that was created from Ynnead?

Description: Sanguinius was found on Baal Secundus, a radioactive moon. The harsh environment led to the Blood Angels' genetic flaws - the Red Thirst and Black Rage.
Question: What was the homeworld of Sanguinius called?

Description: Janus was the first Supreme Grand Master of the Grey Knights. He was secretly one of the Horus Heresy's Knights-Errant, chosen by Malcador the Sigillite.
Question: Who was the first Chapter Master of the Grey Knights?

Description: Revuel Arvida was a Thousand Sons survivor who remained loyal. He was merged with a fragment of Magnus's soul to become Janus, first Grand Master of the Grey Knights.
Question: What is the name of the only loyalist Thousand Sons Marine who remained loyal?

Description: Alpharius and Omegon were twin Primarchs of the Alpha Legion - the only pair. Their Legion's motto 'I am Alpharius' reflects their deceptive, confusing nature.
Question: Who is the Primarch of the Alpha Legion?

Description: The Fall of the Eldar created a massive Warp storm (the Eye of Terror) and killed most of their race. The psychic scream of Slaanesh's birth is sometimes called the Birth Cry.
Question: What is the name of the psychic scream that killed billions when Slaanesh was born?

Description: The Emperor was building a human-controlled section of the Webway to free humanity from Warp travel. Magnus's warning about Horus accidentally breached it, dooming the project.
Question: What is the name of the Webway project the Emperor was working on beneath Terra?

Description: Legions II and XI are the 'Lost Legions' - their Primarchs expunged from records. What happened to them remains a mystery, even to the other Primarchs.
Question: What are the two lost Legions' numbers?

Description: The Ullanor Empire was the massive Ork empire crushed during the Great Crusade. Defeating the Beast there led to Horus being named Warmaster - a fateful decision.
Question: What is the name of the massive Ork empire that existed during the War of the Beast?

Description: Erebus is perhaps the most hated character in 40K lore. As First Chaplain of the Word Bearers, he orchestrated Horus's corruption, setting the Heresy in motion.
Question: What is the name of the Word Bearers Chaplain who helped corrupt Horus?

Description: Magnus, trying to warn the Emperor of Horus's betrayal, used psychic projection that breached the Imperial Webway on Terra. This forced the Emperor to guard it personally.
Question: What planet did Magnus accidentally breach the Emperor's Webway project from?

Description: In 2nd Edition, individual models had different point costs. A basic Space Marine cost 30 points - points values have changed significantly across editions.
Question: What was the original point cost of a standard Space Marine in 2nd Edition?

Description: 7th Edition (2014) introduced Objective Secured for Troops in Combined Arms detachments. The rule made Troops choices more valuable for capturing objectives.
Question: What edition introduced the 'Objective Secured' rule?

Description: Space Crusade (1990) was the first 40K-branded video game, though based on the board game. True computer games like Space Hulk (1993) followed.
Question: What was the name of the first Warhammer 40,000 video game released in 1992?

Description: The Emperor created the Primarchs himself using his own genetic material and Warp power (some sources say bargaining with Chaos). Amar Astarte helped create Space Marine gene-seed.
Question: What is the name of the Emperor's genetic scientist who created the Primarchs?
Answers: The Emperor himself with help from forbidden lore

Description: The Master of the Astronomican leads the psykers who power the beacon. Thousands burn out and die maintaining the Emperor's light.
Question: What is the original name of the Astronomican choir's leader?

Description: Angron was enslaved and had Butcher's Nails implanted as a gladiator on Nuceria. The Emperor 'saved' him by teleporting him away, abandoning his comrades to death.
Question: Who was the first human to receive the Butcher's Nails implants?

Description: The Dropsite Massacre on Isstvan V occurred in 006.M31 when four traitor Legions ambushed seven loyal Legions. Three Primarchs were lost that day.
Question: What is the exact date of the Dropsite Massacre on Isstvan V?

Description: Aza'gorod is the true name of the Nightbringer, the C'tan of death. Its image appears in the fear of death across many species - it taught the galaxy to fear dying.
Question: What is the true name of the C'tan known as The Nightbringer?

Description: The Void Dragon is a C'tan shard imprisoned beneath Mars. Some believe it's the Omnissiah the Mechanicus worship. Its presence may explain Mars's technological advancement.
Question: What is the name of the ancient AI that helped create the Void Dragon myth on Mars?

Description: Adeptus Titanicus was released in 1988, featuring Epic-scale Titans. The specialist game has been revived multiple times, most recently in 2018.
Question: What year was the original Warhammer 40,000 'Adeptus Titanicus' specialist game released?
RegExDescription: Accepts 1988 in numeric or word form

Description: Bob Naismith sculpted the original 'beaky' Space Marine in 1987. This iconic design with its pointed helmet remains beloved and was recently re-released.
Question: Who sculpted the original plastic Space Marine released in 1987?

Description: Warhammer 40,000 was developed as 'Rogue Trader' before becoming a full wargame. The Rogue Trader title became background lore for independent human explorers.
Question: What was the working title of Warhammer 40,000 during development?
